story:
September 1,  2014 : Final announcement

PRISMicide for Bitcoin project has been renamed Bitcoin Pinpad : www.bitcoinpinpad.com

PRISMicide hardware board part is now called Origami Board : www.origamiboard.com

PRISMicide pro-privacy foundation opens its new website : www.prismicide.com

Thank You all for the donations and preorders done here through Indiegogo or with bitcoins. Please Check the new websites above for the last updates!

ARCHIVED DESCRIPTION :


The new security PRISMcide solution consists of "open source" smart cards and of a small "open hardware" portable player that can be used with Android and iOS smartphones and tablets via bluetooth and also, via USB with Windows, Mac OS and Linux computers. It is

  • Open source smart card based security development platform
  • + Multiplatform portable reader 
  • = Best secure hardware wallet for crypto-currencies

PRISMicide democratizes security solutions based on the banking industry and telecommunications smart cards.

A Bitcoin wallet with an unparalleled security

Many Bitcoin users already had their accounts' private keys stolen, either because they have entrusted their keys to online services with a defaulting security (see the MtGox scandal), or because they've been direct victims of local attacks (malware, trojans...) on their personal computers or smart phones.

The smart card protects the keys…

PRISMicide for Bitcoin allows each user to secure its private key within a smart card. These private keys are then used directly via the smart card to sign the transactions as requested by its owner but will never be exposed to the potentially compromised computers, smartphones or tablets that are used to perform these transactions.

… and the small portable player secure the use of the card

Although the keys are protected against theft, they must also be protected from hidden misuse. Indeed, some attackers distort approved transactions: the owner of an account believes he is validating a small transaction towards one of his friends' account, as indicated on his computer screen (or smart phone), but he is actually validating a transaction that empties his account, sending the bitcoins to the pirate's account.

The small secured portable player makes that type of attack impossible by posting on its own screen the real details of the transaction requested prior its validation. It's also on this player that the PIN code of the smart card is entered.

Users have a personal terminal for payments that they can use and trust even on unsecured computers or smartphones and also, with potentially compromised third parties (i.e. Shop POS).

Hierarchical Deterministic (BIP 32) Wallet

The card holds a Hierarchical Deterministic (BIP 32) Wallet seed - which means that if a user have backed up this seed, he is able to regenerate all his private keys generated by the card. The PRISMicide reader let users do this backup when the seed is generated during first time setup. (Optionnaly, users can enter their own seed).

Multisig support

PRISMicide can create and use escrow accounts through "2 of 2", "2 of 3" and "3 of 3" P2SH multisignature adresses. 

P2SH addresses can be generated on the PRISMicide terminal by inserting several cards and choose the required cooperation "2 of 2", "2 of 3" and "3 of 3". Then you can unlock funds sent to this address by inserting the right number of cards depending on the chosen escrow model to sign the transaction.

Why Hardware Wallets are so important ?

Let's quote two great speakers...

"We need to make it easier for mainstream users to use Bitcoin securely. [...] Hardware Wallets, which are basically devices that can securely hold you bitcoin and allow you to transact bitcoins, are going to become very important in 2014 because for most people, their general purpose PC or Macintosh computers or their Android or iOS phone is not exactly secure"

Andreas Antonopoulos
May, 21th 2014

"Today there is no bank that says you can use any virus infested computers and safely access your bank account and today you can do that with Bitcoin: You can log on to a virus infested computer and using a hardware wallet, not have any concerns about using a virus infected computer to do your transactions and that's really different."

David Silva Smith
2014 Coin Congress

Those preliminary specifications may change during the final component selection.
Reader:
- ARM Cortex M4 family CPU (2Mo Flash)
- Bluetooth 4.0 (BLE) module
- Micro USB port for charging battery and PC/MAC communication
- Full USB port as expansion slot
- 3.2" TFT 240*320 or 400
- DecKa OS for Cortex M4 (open source branch)

Smart Card: 
- ARM secure core based chipset
- DecKa OS for ARM secure core (open source branch)

DecKa OS is a security features focused operating system. 
It was mostly developed for secure elements like smart cards.
This OS is already used inside deployed solutions. Recent releases were used by USB smart cards from hardwarewallet.com that are available here as perks and easy-to-play-with smart card based solution (with open API).
DecKa OS was adapted to be used on "larger" core like Cortex M4 based CPU.

Decka OS aleady exists as a closed source solution. A first open source branch will be opened for this project, thanks to the great help of BTChip.com.
 


Team

Here is a brief introduction of the "public" part of our team. If you want to read more information on someone, please use his Linkedin profile link.

PRISMicide is a registered non profit Organization.

Frédéric MARTIN / PRISMicide Co-founder (Linkedin Profile)
System Architect. Frederic is working for more than eight years inside the smart card industry and was getting tired to wait for a fully open source smart card platform to build secure solutions he can trust on every levels...

Nicolas BACCA / PRISMicide Co-founder (Linkedin Profile)
Smart Card Security Expert. Nicolas is specialized in Secure embedded development and working since 2000 for major smart card industry players. He already backuped Bitcoin related projects like btchip.com and hardwarewallet.com.

Olivier Tomaz (Linkedin Profile) 
Information technology engineer, security designer and digital security architect. Olivier is working inside the smart card industry for more than seven years. He likes to play on swings too. :)

Laurent Fazio (Linkedin Profile)
Embedded Developer. Open source technologies enthousiast, Laurent worked as multimedia set top boxes Linux Engineer, smartgrid embeded sensors developer and team leader for a Linux distribution editor.

Yannick Almeras (Linkedin Profile)

Electronic Engineer. Yannick has a wide experience in electronic hardware design and prototyping, from sonars to wireless communication systems and related certifications.

Few other guys joined the team but simply did not want to share their private information here.

Motivation

The PRISMicide project community's security professionals share the same conclusions and observations:

●  the need for effective security tools to prevent hackers or isolated scrupulous government programs (i.e. NSA/PRISM scandal) attacks

●  the absence of fully open source solutions that use secure reliable elements such as smart cards

●  the low security software environments used by smart phones and tablets

●  the increase in piracy-related attacks linked with crypto-currencies like Bitcoin

The main goal of PRISMicide project is to provide the perfect platform for the development of security services such as data encryption, electronic signature, online authentication, SMS encryption or ultra-secure messaging.

We'll add questions and answers during the campaign...Anyway, the first application available immediately with the platform will be a secured materialized wallet ("hardware wallet") for Bitcoin users.
 

We don't start from nothing. Your money will be used to finalize and accelerate project development.  

Please remember PRISMicide is a registered non-profit organization. 

We already invested great amounts of our time and money into this project because we want this platform to be available for our own needs... We hope this crowdfunding campaign will cover parts of our investment. Our official initial goal is to raise 40 000$. This should only cover very basic costs. We'll probably have to reach 60 000$ to cover most of essential costs. 70 000$ would allow to cover the 3d printer cost.  That's why stretch goals starts at 80 000$ (see below).

We already...
- have our own smart card operating system (years of work, this is an open source branch of the professional work of BTChip.com)
- hardware wallet application
- built our dream team
- made the feasibility study and cost estimation

We need to...
- physically evaluate few different components to make our final parts selection
- complete the electronic design
- develop the basic Android and iPhone Bitcoin application
- make one or two PCB testings/rounds for prototypes
- start first batch production

Bonus video of our Raspberry Pi based prototype that was used to show what future user experience should be: 

 

PRISMicide smart cards and readers should be available by the end of this year. We should be able to stick to this date if this campaign meets a great success. 

What we'll do:

- Weekly updates on blog/twitter. We mean it.
- No unexplained delay, if temporary shit happens, we'll tell you so
- We know our first prototype run will not be perfect, This is why we take this into account. Money and agenda are planned for three rounds of prototype. Delivered products will not be alpha releases.
- As stated below, we won't use solid molds, so no useless wait for casing.

A quick note from the backers perspective : 

Some of our team members already participated to crowdfunding campaign as backers and sometimes, project owners treated backers with disrespect: no updates, no answers, no real consideration. No way, we won't act like that.

A real challenge.
Front: LCD touch screen
Back: Smart card slot

We don't want to have to wait months to have plastic injection molds. 
We thought using 3D printers and publish 3D casing files would be better. So we'll use 3D printers to build casing and you'll be able to do so too...

Later, we'll probably make other "non-3D printers based" compatible casings available... but for now we all agree we need to go fast and open :)


See below to preorder perks with Bitcoins

Bitcoin prices at the lower right of each perk box.

SHIPMENT COSTS ARE NOT INCLUDED : WE DO NOT WANT TO CHARGE EVERYONE THE SAME HIGH COSTS FOR EVERYWHERE AROUND THE WORLD. Some people want costly express services, some people don't.... some others want warranty or tracking services... so everyone will be contacted later to choose shipment according their location and expectations.

USB readers are here to simplify tests and direct smart card access from PC and MAC computers. This is very useful when debugging and developing applications. (These readers won't be part of the final PRISMicide solution).

IF YOU WANT TO PREORDER WITH BITCOINS, PLEASE CONTACT PREORDER@PRISMICIDE.COM

What are USB Smart Cards ?

USB smart cards from hardwarewallet.com (developed by BTChip) are closed source USB small devices that are not part of PRISMicide platform but share most parts of the APDU API (we have common team elements).

USB smart cards are a great way to experience smart card based hardware wallets. They can be used as stand alone USB keys.

They are available here as perks because :

  • We all have enough T-shirts :)
  • it is fun to promote a low cost hardware wallet too
  • BTChip helps this project to raise more money through these perks

if you want more information about these USB smart cards, go to the official hardwarewallet.com website.

USB Smart cards are not compatible with PRISMicide reader.
ONLY ISO/standard smart cards (like PRISMicide ones) can be used inside PRISMicide readers. By the way, if you have smart card development skill, please remember you can develop your own smart card solution (you are not forced to use our smart cards).

What is the USB reader ? 

It is a simple standard smart card reader with USB connectivity. Not built by our team, it is a simple product and an easy tool to test, develop and diagnose PRISMicide smart cards without having to use the full PRISMicide reader.


Binaries (with source code) for Windows/Mac/Linux will be bundled with this small reader to help you to play with the PRISMicide smart card APDU API.


When we talk about this project to developers, hacktivists and "ordinary" people, lots of projects are often mentioned. So we already have many future projects and groups of people gathering around these ideas.

Let's be optimistic and imagine we can reach those goals below... here is the project that will be accelerated / focused on:

80 000 $
Focus on... SMS Encryption application

90 000 $
Newbie compliant PRISMicide smart Card introduction & documentation
DecKa OS development crash course and basic video tutorials

100 000$
Focus on... File Encryption features and GnuPG / GPG support

If these stretch goals are not reached, these features/services and other ones will only be delayed. We're confident developers communities will join their forces to provide applications for our platform.

For now, it will be enough. If money is really flowing, we'll discuss this further. The real important first step is to reach $40 000.
 



We'll add questions and answers during the campaign... 

>Did we already met somewhere ? Are you guys for real ?

We are mostly known from the french Bitcoin community. You may already meet us at Paris Bitcoin Meetups or events at "la maison du Bitcoin" ("French Bitcoin Embassy"). 
We were present at the official #BITCOIN2014 exhibition organised by the Bitcoin Foundation in Amsterdam (may 2014).

...and many working USB smart card based wallets were given there... :)

>What about Trezor project ?

Trezor was a great first step to provide a first "open" hardware wallet. We can't deny that point. It is still a great project.  Here are the main differences:
- PRISMicide is compatible with mobile platforms
- PRISMicide is based on a real secure element (smart card)
- PRISMicide has a bigger screen and input options for other applications than Bitcoin
- PRISMicide OS (both on the terminal and the card) is designed with applications lifecycle and isolation in mind to avoid reflashing the full firmware for each newly developed application
- PRISMicide is not just about Bitcoins, not even just about crypto-currencies, it is a real development platform for people to build their own secure solutions.

>I am already using a software wallet I like, can I use it with your hardware wallet ?

PRISMicide will provide very basic software bitcoin client for Android, then iPhone/iPad, then Linux/Mac OSX, then Windows.

We don't want to compete with existing great software wallets. We want to work with these software providers to be an optional secure storage and validation tool for their own solution.

PRISMicide wants to become an open standard and has already contact several wallet software providers (Multibit, KryptoKit, Electrum, Dark Wallet...) to ensure future compatibility.

>Great introduction... hmmm... elle n'existerait pas en français ?

Sisi, là : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5866H4E29rA 

(French video link above... you were warned :) )

>My compagny would like to work with PRISMicide team on a special project...

Please contact us at partners@prismicide.com

>I have another question...

Please contact us at questions@prismicide.com

>I work for a blog, newspaper, tv... may I contact you...

Please contact us at media@prismicide.com

>Why a unicorn inside DecKa OS logo?

Because Why Not.


>Can you... are you sure we can... ?

Of course. 
When losing confidence, please look below.


>How can I help ?


Support us and/or SPREAD THE WORD TO YOUR FRIENDS !

For other questions, please mail questions@prismicide.com

story:
Hey IndieGoers,

 My name is Jayson Vasquez. If you dont know me like my family and friends do, I am a husband and father of 4. Lover of fashion, music and concerts. My wife Michelle and I have recently welcomed a beautiful baby girl, Elise Everly into our family. Along with our son,Tyler and older sisters Autumn and Jessica. Michelle is in her last semester of nursing school and i am so proud of all of them. Im looking to turn my passion for fashion and rock into a business called SurferRosa Trading Co. where i can buy and sell unique products at events and festivals to supplement my income while still spending valuable time with my family. My first product for SurferRosa will be headwear that you can wear many different ways. They have great designs and styles that can be used with versatility and function. Check out the video and see for yourself.

 Our extra expenses are spent getting Michelle through nursing school, so you can imagine why i am asking for your help getting started. Your contributions will go toward start up expenses for the business and product staging (tables, tablecloths, stands, etc..) . I need funds to set up a website and secure larger events and display my product properly and also to discover other unique brands that fit the SurferRosa profile in the future. Like Worm from the movie Rounders said, "I've got the knife and a fork, the table is all set. All I need now is the stake."

I can make this a profitable venture for my family with your help. If you can contribute, I hope you will be a part of this with me. There are some perks waiting for you. If you can't donate, please share with your friends on social media. Like our page on Facebook. Everything helps! Thanks for viewing and Rock on!

Jayson Vasquez/ SurferRosa Trading Co.

Thesquez23@yahoo.com

My wife Michelle and I have recently welcomed a beautiful baby girl, Elise Everly into our family. Along with our son,Tyler and older sisters Autumn and Jessica. Michelle is in her last semester of nursing school and i am so proud of all of them. Im looking to turn my passion for fashion and rock into a business called SurferRosa Trading Co. where i can buy and sell unique products at events and festivals to supplement my income while still spending valuable time with my family. My first product for SurferRosa will be headwear that you can wear many different ways. They have great designs and styles that can be used with versatility and function. Check out the video and see for yourself. Our extra expenses are spent getting Michelle through nursing school, so you can imagine why i am asking for your help getting started. Your contributions will go toward start up expenses for the business and product staging (tables, tablecloths, stands, etc..) . I need funds to set up a website and secure larger events and display my product properly and also to discover other unique brands that fit the SurferRosa profile in the future. Like Worm from the movie Rounders said, "I've got the knife and a fork, the table is all set. All I need now is the stake." I can make this a profitable venture for my family with your help. If you can contribute, I hope you will be a part of this with me. There are some perks waiting for you. If you can't donate, please share with your friends on social media. Like our page on Facebook. Everything helps! Thanks for viewing and Rock on!Jayson Vasquez/ SurferRosa Trading Co.Thesquez23@yahoo.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Charlotte Burkhart. I live in Wellington New Zealand, and i have been running my small jewellery business L.S.D.(Little Sister Desings) For 4 Years. I adore creating and designing jewellery, it is more than just a business to me it is my passion. I love to make unique jewellery that inspires people, and helps them show their individuality. My jewellery is very dark, mysterious and beautiful. A lot of it contains replica castings of human teeth, bird claws, bones and re-thought replicas of antique / art nouveau Rings. My new line would continue on this idea and expand, using beautiful custom cut gemstones like moonstone, labradorite and Onyx. 

I sell my jewellery mostly online through etsy, but also have my own beautiful website i created last year.

I am starting this campaign because I am bursting with new ideas for my new 2013 Range "The Killing Moon", but unfortunately i don't have the means to fund every good idea i have. I have created several new pieces in "The Killing Moon" Collection, but i need your help to complete the collection. The good news is every contribution will get a 20% off code that will go towards the new collection when it is completed (Or towards any of the current items if you are so inclined).

If i reach my minimum goal i will be able to creatue at least 5 new designs to go towards my 2013 collection. Five may not sound like much, but a lot of costs accumulate with each design in the production process. but the more money that is funded the more L.S.D. i can create!

What We Need:

The funding needed will go towards these costs:

  • Getting Moulds made of each item, so it can be reproduced, (Approx $50 per mould, $250 total for 5 moulds)
  • Buying & Getting bulk Semi Precious Stones made and cut to the specifications i need (Approx $10-$35 per stone, and i would need to buy bulk, and this could cost up to $800) 
  • Supplies like chain, findings etc.
  • Getting the Jewellery Cast in to Sterling Silver and Bronze (Depends on how many castings i get done of each but i would need at least $400 to get a few castings of each piece. 
  • A portion of the funds will be used for shipping your perks, but this has been added to the price of each perk. Therefore, if i meet $1500 goal on here i will have to set aside an amount for shipping (It could be several hundred dollars). Therefore i hope to raise more than the goalset so i can reach the true target.
  • Even If i don't reach my goal, i will still get as many items cast and created possible, and you will still receive your perks. Every contribution helps and is greatly appreciated and will help expand my store!

If i exceed my goal (Wow!) here is what i will do with it:

  • $1800: Create another piece and get it moulded and cast ready for production
  • $2000: Create another two pieces and get moulded and cast ready for production
  • $2100: the above and also create a new one of a kind piece
  • $2500: the above and also get a new range of custom foil stamped, luxurious leather boxes created with the logo L.S.D.
  • $2700: The above and also a range of postcards/flyers to promote my work in stores
  • $3000: All of the above and more one of a kind & gallery pieces
  • All money raised will go towards the making of my new range, promotion and packaging.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute any money, thats fine! But you could help me a ton by sharing my campain on your blog, facebook, or any other social media. This will help get the word out about my campaign and could make a huge difference!

story:
Squeaken! So my Team of Mushrooms and I have decided that we want to do a kick starter to remake the dome heads and make them safe to wear thus giving us the chance to make King Squeak. Squeaky the Golden Mushroom is broken so bad that she was falling apart and ripping all through out Cosplay Chess at Sakuracon 2014.

Any additional funds would be donated to Childs Play, a game industry charity dedicated to improving the lives of children with toys and games in their network of over 70 hospitals worldwide.

So to anyone and everyone who Loves Squeaky and would love to see her come back as Squeaky 2.0, this is what we have decided for the donation prizes. Please keep in mind that any photos with Squeaky and photo shoot be restricted to the Seattle Area.

story:
Hier gibt es alle Texte auf Deutsch | German translation



LT54: Sportswear, equipment and lifestyle fashion for athletes, coaches and sports fans!





A) The short version:


1. Who are you?

Leopard Lengerich e.V. – a German nonprofit-organization, founded in 2004 by Yako Alarslan, dedicated to the advancement of sports and their benefits to children and young people.


2. What will you do with the money?

Secure the final stages of a well thought out concept – the launch of LT54, a fashion and sports brand. Sales of LT54 labeled products will fund our further growth, including sending our most prominent Taekwondo athlete, Levent Tuncat, to the Olympic Games Rio 2016. We will start by providing elegant, comfortable presentation suits / tracksuits and a brand-new variety of Taekwondo target pads.


3. Why crowdfunding?

We no longer look for support from investment banks, multinational corporations or public funds. We value our independence and wish to spread the word on LT54 to the people directly. We want to dress you in style and provide outstanding equipment, the likes of which you have never seen before.


4. Are there risks to this campaign?

Risks are minimal at worst. We pre-financed all previous stages of research & development and have our first product in storage already; the aforementioned presentation suit / tracksuit. Securing a larger number of this item, producing the first batch of our one-of-a-kind Taekwondo target pads and developing a suitable web shop are the main points on our to-do-list.

We are well experienced at managing complex projects and benefit from a relatively large coverage. A great example of our managing skills is our upcoming "1st International Taekwondo Training-Camp with the World Stars." We want to send you there as well.


5. Any further info?

We appreciate your support and say THANK YOU! Should you be short of funds momentarily, then spread the word about this campaign and share it on all channels you use.

We are creating stylish T-shirts just for this campaign and also offer all products at reduced prices; early bird or not. Each and every LT54 campaign backer is getting a good value for his or her money.

By the way...hurry up if you wish to attend our Taekwondo Training-Camp. :-)



B) The longer version:


1. Who are you?

We are athletes with a vision! The sports and social project, Leopard Lengerich e.V., was launched in 2004 by Yako Alarslan. Our mission has always been, and will remain as such, to offer children, adolescents and young adults an alternative to boredom, drugs and violence. Unfortunately, all of these dominate the lives of many young people. Through Taekwondo, hip hop dance and Kick-Thaiboxing-K1, our organization enables healthy, constructive ways to break vicious circles and master similar life difficulties. Leopard Lengerich e.V. is a nonprofit-organization, officially recognized by Germany as such.

Our athletic departments combine physical workout with psychological elements such as body language, breathing and voice. Course participants will be able to carry on in life with strengthened self-confidence. In addition to the pleasant side effect of athletic achievements, our primary focus lies on social and integrative commitments. Our organization takes volunteering very seriously and is pleased with the active participation of our coaches, parents, students and friends.

Thanks to the high dedication displayed by our coaches, athletic successes at national and international levels were soon to follow. Since 2009, several German, European and world championship titles have been won by our athletes. Furthermore, our organization is represented at state level and even within the German Taekwondo national team itself. The most successful and famous member of Leopard Lengerich e.V. is Levent Tuncat, participant of the Olympic Games Beijing 2008 and Germany's choice for the Olympic Games Rio 2016 in the category men's 58 kg Taekwondo competition.




2. What will you do with the money?

Helping people help themselves! The athletic departments of Leopard Lengerich e.V. have garnered respect within Germany continuously. Our prospects team consists of unique talents of both sexes and diverse age ranges. Leopard Lengerich e.V. is the only nonprofit-organization in Germany, perhaps Europe or even worldwide that generates such successful, exceptional athletes. A fact that must be noted expressly – we have always funded ourselves entirely and successfully; no support from sponsors.

Having stated this, the unprecedented success of our members have catapulted our expenses to increasingly exorbitant levels. We wish and must continue to support our athletes in their (further) development. However, we are not asking for a donation, quite the contrary. Supported by Levent Tuncat, we want to provide all sports fans, as well as the Taekwondo martial arts as such, something in and of itself.

Leopard Lengerich e.V. has created the fashion and sports brand LT54, not only to continue to meet our organization's financial and development needs, but also to dress all sports fans in practical and stylish fashion. We will start by providing elegant, comfortable presentation suits / tracksuits. They are made of cotton, available in 128, 140, 156, 164, 176, S, M, L, XL, and XXL.






LT54 will provide outstanding equipment as well, starting with a never before seen Taekwondo target pad. It represents an evolution on how to train your kicks. We have developed and improved our unique Taekwondo target pad for over two years continuously – a full year of research & development and over a year of testing / quality management.

Levent Tuncat has shown it to his peers in the German Taekwondo national team, its trainers and staff, various Olympic, world, European and Asian champions as well as other elite Taekwondo practitioners. It has been tested by such champions as Servet Tazegül, Aaron Cook, Aziz Acharki, Dong-Eon Lee, Bahri Tanrikulu, Reshmie Oogink and Jaouad Achab extensively, in our own club as well.

Reactions to our custom Taekwondo target pad have been exceptionally positive. Now we want to share our secret with the rest of the world. Before we can release more information however, or even go as far as market them appropriately, we also wish to patent / trademark our development.


We have a few dozen items of our first product in our hands already, the presentation suit / tracksuit mentioned above. This campaign aims to ensure the continued production of this item, generate the first commercial batch of our Taekwondo target pads and finance our online portal's launch; web development, hosting / server, administration, maintenance, etc. Any surplus will go into development and manufacture of new products and to support our mission.


This campaign intends to cover the various costs of a proper market launch:




3. Why crowdfunding?

Together we are strong! We have been able to pre-finance the previous stages of development on our own so far. However, crucial steps remain to be taken. We have been searching for sponsors for months now, without noteworthy success unfortunately. We have taken notice, with some regret, that neither the regional industry nor other German "big players" are willing, at times without any feedback given, to support this unique and successful project in Germany. Meanwhile, crowdfunding has risen, also in Germany, displaying great potential. Well thought out concepts can reach a greater support through small amounts than by "large contributions" of a precious few investment banks, multinational corporations or public funds.


4. Are there risks to this campaign?

No arrogance intended, but risks are either nonexistent or minimal at worst! Leopard Lengerich e.V. thrives for over 10 years successfully! All planning aspects, production and distribution have been set up already and are on schedule. Our regional sports press coverage is relatively large, goods storage and distribution channels are secure. Our website is just being developed, making it our most current matter.

Since our foundation, we have successfully managed complex events and championships as well as the development of our athletes' careers, both nationally and internationally, even as far as participating in the Olympic Games. To increase your confidence in us even further, we introduce you to an ambitious project that we have been managing since January 2015. Parallel to this campaign, we want to promote the sport of Taekwondo in football-centric Germany and Europe. To this end, we are also hosting an event of superlatives, the "1st International Taekwondo Training-Camp with the World Stars," which will run from May 22nd through 24th, 2015 in Lengerich, Germany.

At least one of this campaign's perks will let you attend the event, either with special rates or other benefits. Over 200 athletes from all over Europe, America and Asia have registered already. The registration fees finance its realization already. This campaign shall enhance the success of the Taekwondo Training-Camp as well, thus enhancing the success of the LT54 brand launch even further.




5. Any further info?

We appreciate your support and say THANK YOU! Should you be short of funds momentarily, then spread the word about this campaign and share it on all channels you use.

We offer all products at reduced prices; early bird or not. Each and every LT54 campaign backer is getting a good value for his or her money. Prices will be adjusted once the campaign is over.

Stylish T-shirts, made just for this campaign, are being developed at this moment. Therefore, we will be able to start delivering them in July already. They are made of cotton and feature modern short sleeves, available in 110-116, 122-128, 134-140, 146-152, 158-164, S, M, L, XL, and XXL. We demand high quality end products, thus these T-shirts are not average, cheap mass productions so often found among this kind of clothing. The following picture shows our initial concept. We will display further pictures, including models, in due time:



Please notice that our "1st International Taekwondo Training-Camp with the World Stars" starts on May 22nd; a mere three weeks time. If you wish to attend, regardless of this campaign's wrap up, you should make haste in regards to perk booking and travel preparations. More information on this event can be found on our website.

story:
Short Summary


Hello! My name is Austin Bentley. I work primarily as a freelance designer for musicians. As a youngling, I was always drawn to band shirts that stood out from the crowd. This gave me the desire to add to this outlandish enterprise!

Over the past months, I've had constant questions from friends and fans as to why I don't sell my designs on my own shirts? Time, and money. To invest into something like this is just something I can't do on my own! That's where this campaign comes in.

The idea is simple..! I have 3 designs that I drew up that have gotten some great feedback from fans like you! I plan to print these shirts for everyone, but the first step is too big to take for myself. The money it will cost to get these printed is $1200 dollars, an amount that I can simply not afford without help. So here's the deal- You help me, I help you! Depending on how much you donate, you get some neat perks! By donating, not only are you fueling my passion as an artist and fulfilling my dreams as a designer, you'll get some neat shirts!

Should this campaign be successful, the amount of exposure and promotion I will recieve simply from you wearing my art will be exponential, and I will be truly in the debt of my fans. As I already am for the support up until this point. Without your help, I'm doomed!

I have always been amazed by the power of one individual when they put their mind to something, and even more so by the power of a group of people working together. It is my hope that I can encourage you to join me on my mission to change the face of apparel.

 

What I Need & What You Get

Plain and simple, I need $1200 dollars to get these shirts printed (150 shirts in total). This is the exact amount to get it done, meaning I am to make no profit on this. Your money goes directly into the making of these shirts, and then directly to you. Keep in mind, if I do not meet my goal you will recieve a full refund for the amount you pledged.
Here's some of the perks you can expect when you donate!
 

Gut Goulash T-shirt

Space Squid T-shirt

Omega T-shirt

 

Single Edition Signed "Space Squid" Print

Get Your Own Design Made!

11 X 17 Black and White Squid Print

 


The Impact

By contributing to my campaign, hopefully I can add a titch bit of creativity to your wardrobe, while you have helped me evolve in many ways as an artist, and in my career. For that I am eternally greatful.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a donation, but you still want to help? The power of social networking is one of the mightest tools at our disposal. Simply share this page on your facebook page, twitter, blog, etc.. Anything and everything helps! Tell your friends and family, tell your cat! Everything matters!
 

Visit me online!

The idea is simple..! I have 3 designs that I drew up that have gotten some great feedback from fans like you! I plan to print these shirts for everyone, but the first step is too big to take for myself. The money it will cost to get these printed is $1200 dollars, an amount that I can simply not afford without help. So here's the deal- You help me, I help you! Depending on how much you donate, you get some neat perks! By donating, not only are you fueling my passion as an artist and fulfilling my dreams as a designer, you'll get some neat shirts!
Should this campaign be successful, the amount of exposure and promotion I will recieve simply from you wearing my art will be exponential, and I will be truly in the debt of my fans. As I already am for the support up until this point. Without your help, I'm doomed!
I have always been amazed by the power of one individual when they put their mind to something, and even more so by the power of a group of people working together. It is my hope that I can encourage you to join me on my mission to change the face of apparel.
 


What I Need & What You Get
Plain and simple, I need $1200 dollars to get these shirts printed (150 shirts in total). This is the exact amount to get it done, meaning I am to make no profit on this. Your money goes directly into the making of these shirts, and then directly to you. Keep in mind, if I do not meet my goal you will recieve a full refund for the amount you pledged.
Here's some of the perks you can expect when you donate!
 
Gut Goulash T-shirt

Space Squid T-shirt

Omega T-shirt

 
Single Edition Signed "Space Squid" Print



Get Your Own Design Made!

11 X 17 Black and White Squid Print

 


The Impact
By contributing to my campaign, hopefully I can add a titch bit of creativity to your wardrobe, while you have helped me evolve in many ways as an artist, and in my career. For that I am eternally greatful.


Other Ways You Can Help
Can't make a donation, but you still want to help? The power of social networking is one of the mightest tools at our disposal. Simply share this page on your facebook page, twitter, blog, etc.. Anything and everything helps! Tell your friends and family, tell your cat! Everything matters!
 

Visit me online!

story:
Class Struggle Clothing was started with the idea of trying to provide people with casual apparel that they can feel good about wearing. Our garments are manufactured by Jerico in Toronto, Ontario. Jerico takes pride in treating their employees as they should be treated, like human beings. A local artisan in Calgary, Alberta is bringing our designs to life on a state of the art silk screen printer.  We hope that through our name and logos the public will become aware and educated as to what the idea of "class struggle" is and help make people think about how their consumer choices affect other people's quality of life. Please visit our website to learn more about Class Struggle Clothing! classstruggleclothing.com


Thanks for stopping by! Below are some images of our clothing and a little bit more about our campaign! 


100% Ring spun cotton Men's T-shirts. Available in xs-3xl 

*These are digitally produced images. It cannot be guaranteed that the final product will appear exactly as they do in the photos. Please check out Jerico's website to view the t- shirts our graphics will be printed on. 


100% Ring spun cotton Women's T-shirts. Available in s-2xl

*These are digitally produced images and it cannot be guaranteed that the final products will appear exactly as they do in the photos. Please check out Jerico's website to view the t- shirts our graphics will be printed on. 

           


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $27,000 to build a modest starting inventory, help promote the brand, pay for storage of our goods, and to fairly reimburse all the artists who have made or will be making contributions to Class Struggle Clothing getting off the ground. 
  • To thank you for your support we will be offering your choice of our five designs on either a t-shirt or a hooded sweatshirt depending on the level of your contribution. We think the designs are pretty cool and hope you will too! 
  • Even if we fall a bit short of our goal of raising $27,000, Class Struggle will still be making a serious effort to pursue our vision. Our projected starting inventory may have to be reduced in the event that our goal is not reached, but you can rest assured we will still make a go of it! 

After the campaign is over, we'll send you a personal email so you can select the size, colour and design you want. We'll also keep you updated as to when you will receive your perk! 


The Impact

  • Not only will you get a really cool t-shirt or hoodie for your contribution to Class Struggle Clothing's Indiegogo campaign, you will also be helping to kickstart a company that is focused on improving the work environments that clothing is manufactured in. We know that buying from socially conscious manufacturers like Jerico is a good start, but eventually we want to use our profits to expand Class Struggle Clothing to have our own facilities in nations where people experience unfair and unsafe working conditions. We want everyone involved to be reimbursed fairly for their contributions. We hope you can get behind our brand and support a good cause that has the potential to really make a difference worldwide!


70/30 Bamboo/cotton V-neck T-shirts & Racerback Tank Tops

*These are digitally produced images and it cannot be guaranteed that the final products will appear exactly as they do in the photos. Please check out Jerico's website to view the t-shirts our graphics will be printed on. 


Unisex 50/50 Ring spun cotton/poly hoodies. Available in s-3xl

*These are digitally produced images and it cannot be guaranteed that the final products will appear exactly as they do in the photos. Please check out Jerico's website to view the hoodies our graphics will be printed on. 



Other Ways You Can Help

  • The founder of Class Struggle Clothing is an arts student, so he knows all about being broke! Even if you cannot contribute to our campaign financially, give us a shout out to your friends, mention us at the water cooler at work, or just shout our name out in the street!
  • Social media is such a powerful tool in our world today. Class Struggle Clothing is active on Facebook, Twitter and Pinterest and you can find the links to our profiles on our Indiegogo page. We would really appreciate all the "shares," "likes," "tweets," and "pins" we can get to raise awareness for our company, campaign, and cause!

story:
Welcome to Rott Wear!  We are excited to share with you about our  brand. Inspired by humanity’s best friend…“Big Dawg Eddie”our family Rottweiler. Rott Wear  is more than just a Private Label Clothing Company.  It’s a company with a serious mission and the belief that we can all do more for ourselves and others through positive words. Sometimes we just need some inspiration to get us going and Rott Wear  will do just that.  Read about “Big Dawg Eddie’s” story further down on this page…

Founder:  Lewis A. Oliveros

What is Rott Wear?                                                                                                Apparel for everyone with a touch of Attitude  and for those who need some Inspiration  to conquer the day. We use Big Bold  words to use on the whole shirt like an art canvas. We are thinking outside the box.                                                                                                   

Why Rott Wear?                                                                                                                                    What we do I have not seen in the industry. I always see these small messages on shirts from the big brand names that you pay these high prices for and that's supposed to inspire me? Are you serious!! That encouraged me to start designing my own shirts that would truly get me and you motivated to go out and make things happen.  I started designing my own shirts with big and bold powerful words, then I went out and showed about a hundred people what I was creating.  Something cool started to happen, over 90% of those people loved them! I then knew I was on to something! So I kept designing and putting my ideas to work. I have over 300 designs to date, but we can only start with a few at first. Also, why are the biggest American born brands having their apparel made overseas when the cost of manufacturing in the USA has decreased significantly? We have decided to have our apparel  MADE IN USA. 

Why Indiegogo?  What a great way to share our Brand and our Mission with everyone in the world. It’s a great opportunity for people to get involved in the beginning of a company’s dream from scratch and a way to help us make a difference for other great organizations.

OUR MISSION: 

1). Giving can be contagious. Rott Wear  is dedicated to donating to animal shelters  or individuals that have dedicated their lives to Loving and Caring for the abandoned, abused animals throughout our country and the world…we are committed to giving (100% of net proceeds) of our sales each and every month to different animal shelters and foundations. 

 

2). Economic Impact:  All our apparel will be MADE IN USA.  We have partnered with local companies in the united states and they will help bring our ideas and designs to life.  Made In America will create a positive impact in our economy as well as give us complete quality control to make sure YOU only get the highest quality apparel in the industry.


3.) Inspire Humanity:  Our apparel is made with the Attitude that we can live out our dreams and help others. 

Who is Big Dawg Eddie?  

"BIG DAWG Eddie" was our beloved Rottweiler that passed away in 2011 from cancer. We rescued him at about 3 months old as he was on the verge of dying. He was so sick the vets said he would probably not make it in the next 24 hrs. But don’t be sad, he lived a happy and healthy 11 years. He had too much Attitude and Fight within him to give up. He was our family member, protector and "face licker" to everyone that had the privilege to meet him. Rott Wear  is inspired by you old buddy. Lets Do This!!

How Will Your Funding Help?  We strongly believe Rott Wear  will make a difference in more ways than one. Your funding will help us secure branding and launch the first 6 designs. We pulled the trigger first by already donating $1,000 to a shelter in need before selling any apparel. With your support we can launch this brand and continue donating to animal shelters at least once per month for years to come!

APPAREL:

Premium Fabric.. Our fabrics are made of 100% Combed Ring Spun Cotton for our current signature series line.  It feels like SILK!!! This cotton fiber is incredibly soft, comfortable, super strong , lite weight and breathable for any use.                   Premium Inks.. The inks we use are water-based. This ink infuses into the material making it last longer and it does not weigh down the shirt like traditional inks do which 99% of the market uses. There is no cracking of the print on our shirts, therefore giving you a product that was truly handcrafted to feel great and last forever.   

Future Designs.. We will launch a new design every month. Who knows, we could end up with hundreds of designs you will love. We wont be upset if your closet is full of ROTT WEAR apparel.  Be secure in knowing that you are helping animal shelters all across the country because you purchased ROTT WEAR clothing.  We already proved that.                                         


1st Phase Signature Series Designs: 



 


 


*A NEW DESIGN WILL BE LAUNCHED EVERY MONTH*

Our “BIG DAWG EDDIE” Guarantee:

*Quality… Premium Fabric and Inks.

*Sizes…Men (S-4XL) Athletic Cut. Women (S-2XL) Junior Cut

*Sizing Advice.. If you don't Iike a snug fit, go up one size. 

*Don’t like how it fits? Send it back for another size and we pay all shipping    cost. Don't forget, we are all built beautifully different.

*Sizing  will be taken at the conclusion of this campaign via email or phone.

When Will I Receive My Purchase?  As soon as our campaign has ended we will ship it out within 4 weeks of us receiving funds from indiegogo. Your patience and understanding is greatly appreciated during this process.

SHIPPING COST: *Free anywhere in the USA. International shipping not yet available. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH for YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
**Only 1-week to pre-order so I can get them made and on your body!**

Our Story
I publish a blog about coffee and I design things. Before I was a designer, I was a barista. Every time a customer would order an "expresso" it made me cringe. Call it a pet peeve if you will. I was sure I wasn't the only one in the coffee world who felt this way. So I made a poster last fall. Now that summer is coming, I wanted to wear it on a t-shirt. Here's your chance to wear one too.

The Impact
You'll look cool, feel comfortable, and passive aggressively correct your customers & friends.

What We Need & What You Get
This is a pre-sale. I don't want to drop my own money on a random box of shirts that may or may not be the sizes people want. This way, you can pre-order a shirt, I produce only the sizes sold and everyone is happy.

The shirts will be printed with water based inks on American Apparel's Tri-Blend Track shirts (subject to availability, alternate choice is the Anvil 50/50 eco). They are really light, super comfy and will most likely become your favorite shirt. I can't promise female versions of the shirt right now, but if there are enough orders and requests, I will totally consider it.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to help out with just a few bucks, I can mail you some buttons or a sticker of the same thing. Sound good?

story:
WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET


I have been selected by Cittadellarte-Fondazione Pistoletto as the Zegna artist-in-residence. I will reside in Biella, Italy at the University of Ideas (UNIDEE) for a total of 4 months, from June 15 through October 15, 2011. My missions entail researching ethics and sustainability in the fashion industry. 


The $12,000 grant covers my stay at UNIDEE (room, board, tuition), however I will need an additional 

$4799 to cover:

♥personal expenses June-October, 2011

♥travel and basic accommodations: Milan, Paris and small textile towns in Italy, all research related

♥professional enrichment (MCAD Citizen Design course)

(Just accepted to the MCAD Sustainable Design Professional Program!)

♥Creative Suite 5 Student Edition design software

♥Digital SLR Camera 


PERKS ---->>>> (look to the right!)


all perks that you see to the right include the previous perk(s)

 e.g.

if you give $25 you get a custom postcard of me, hard at work in Italy AND a thank you on my website.

if you give $50 you get a print, a postcard and a thank you

etc.


REALITY BITES


I first need to get stateside (currently in Germany with my sister) in order to apply for my visa to Italy. This is urgent! While I thought it would be convenient and economical to remain in Europe after finishing my teaching term in Spain this past December (in the case that I was accepted to UNIDEE) it turns out that it was actually not a good idea. Though I was originally told by the German and Italian embassies that I could apply in Germany, I must be in Washington, DC to apply for my visa to Italy. UNIDEE will fly me from NY to Milan roundtrip as part of my grant for the 15 June start date once I make it home.


The reality is that I've worked really hard to present this to the world! I've pulled countless all-nighters working on my doctoral research, my blog and on this video. And for the past two years, I've persistently pursued this dream. More importantly, I've worked hard because I genuinely want to improve lives using design. It's my passion. I can't imagine doing anything else. If I don't raise the funds I'll unfortunately lose the $12,000 grant that I JUST earned by default because I won't be able to apply for my visa or fund my entire research project on my own. 

So here's a bit more about what I do :)


ETHICS VS. AESTHETICS ETHICS + AESTHETICS 

Though the aesthetics of fashion are exhilarating, environmentally sustainable practices and socially responsible behavior are hugely lacking in this multi-billion dollar industry. With my work I will strive to awaken a consciousness of fair trade and bio-ethical fashion that supports the creation of sustainable livelihoods for at-risk, Base of the Pyramid (BoP) populations without sacrificing the aesthetics of the “it” bag.

Equipped with my ideas, a notebook and a camera, I will provide an insider’s view into an industry that has historically provided little supply chain visibility and resisted business models that lend to transparency.


SUSTAINABILITY

I will focus on the sustainability practices of the Italian fashion house Ermenegildo Zegna and the Italian textile industry at large in order to provide corporate social responsibility (CSR) guidelines to fashion industry professionals. I will document my work via written reports (which I will submit for publication), blog posts, and photographs (which I will submit to the Inside Out Project). Please visit http://ethos-diseno.tumblr.com/unidee for full details.


THE IMPACT OF YOUR SUPPORT

By supporting me you will contribute to a more socially and environmentally responsible fashion industry and help a girl’s dream come true! Any funds that exceed the requested amount will go toward paying Gambian seamstresses fair wages for manufacturing sustainable school uniforms for Gambian girls in an effort to promote equitable education and empower women seeking dignified work. So please try to go above and beyond the goal! It will go to a great cause!


I believe that the beauty of fashion is most striking when it is refashioned to fight the 8 anti-poverty goals known as the Millennium Development Goals(MDGs). However, when we talk about refashioning fast fashion, we’re talking about a process not a trend. It therefore goes without saying, that this mission is just one step in a much greater process to which I will dedicate my life’s work. The money that you pledge will sustain my work in Italy which will provide a foundation for future missions and allow me to continue once my time at UNIDEE has culminated.


A UNITED, INTERDISCIPLINARY EFFORT


While it is easier to leave design for the creatives, poverty reduction for the economists, education for teachers and the formation of global partnerships to the diplomats, it is much more effective to combine our efforts using an interdisciplinary approach.

Your support will equip me with access to the resources most essential to my research and creative work. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the word! Tweet, Facebook and e-mail your friends and family about my work! Or you can e-mail at ethosmoda (at) gmail (dot) com and I'll send you a widget for my fundraising page to place on your website or blog. Don't underestimate the power you have to make a difference! Every little thing counts!


Thanks for watching and reading and please follow my ethical fashion Italian adventure beginning 15 June 2011!

xoxo,


The Ethical Fashion Missionary <<<----on Facebook ▲ 

▲ The blog---->>> The Ethical Fashion Missionary


ETHOS▲DISEñO ---->>> my website

all perks that you see to the right include the previous perk(s)
 e.g.
if you give $25 you get a custom postcard of me, hard at work in Italy AND a thank you on my website.
if you give $50 you get a print, a postcard and a thank you
etc.







REALITY BITES

I first need to get stateside (currently in Germany with my sister) in order to apply for my visa to Italy. This is urgent! While I thought it would be convenient and economical to remain in Europe after finishing my teaching term in Spain this past December (in the case that I was accepted to UNIDEE) it turns out that it was actually not a good idea. Though I was originally told by the German and Italian embassies that I could apply in Germany, I must be in Washington, DC to apply for my visa to Italy. UNIDEE will fly me from NY to Milan roundtrip as part of my grant for the 15 June start date once I make it home.

The reality is that I've worked really hard to present this to the world! I've pulled countless all-nighters working on my doctoral research, my blog and on this video. And for the past two years, I've persistently pursued this dream. More importantly, I've worked hard because I genuinely want to improve lives using design. It's my passion. I can't imagine doing anything else. If I don't raise the funds I'll unfortunately lose the $12,000 grant that I JUST earned by default because I won't be able to apply for my visa or fund my entire research project on my own. 
So here's a bit more about what I do :)

ETHICS VS. AESTHETICS ETHICS + AESTHETICS 

Though the aesthetics of fashion are exhilarating, environmentally sustainable practices and socially responsible behavior are hugely lacking in this multi-billion dollar industry. With my work I will strive to awaken a consciousness of fair trade and bio-ethical fashion that supports the creation of sustainable livelihoods for at-risk, Base of the Pyramid (BoP) populations without sacrificing the aesthetics of the “it” bag.

Equipped with my ideas, a notebook and a camera, I will provide an insider’s view into an industry that has historically provided little supply chain visibility and resisted business models that lend to transparency.

SUSTAINABILITY

I will focus on the sustainability practices of the Italian fashion house Ermenegildo Zegna and the Italian textile industry at large in order to provide corporate social responsibility (CSR) guidelines to fashion industry professionals. I will document my work via written reports (which I will submit for publication), blog posts, and photographs (which I will submit to the Inside Out Project). Please visit http://ethos-diseno.tumblr.com/unidee for full details.

THE IMPACT OF YOUR SUPPORT

By supporting me you will contribute to a more socially and environmentally responsible fashion industry and help a girl’s dream come true! Any funds that exceed the requested amount will go toward paying Gambian seamstresses fair wages for manufacturing sustainable school uniforms for Gambian girls in an effort to promote equitable education and empower women seeking dignified work. So please try to go above and beyond the goal! It will go to a great cause!

I believe that the beauty of fashion is most striking when it is refashioned to fight the 8 anti-poverty goals known as the Millennium Development Goals(MDGs). However, when we talk about refashioning fast fashion, we’re talking about a process not a trend. It therefore goes without saying, that this mission is just one step in a much greater process to which I will dedicate my life’s work. The money that you pledge will sustain my work in Italy which will provide a foundation for future missions and allow me to continue once my time at UNIDEE has culminated.

A UNITED, INTERDISCIPLINARY EFFORT

While it is easier to leave design for the creatives, poverty reduction for the economists, education for teachers and the formation of global partnerships to the diplomats, it is much more effective to combine our efforts using an interdisciplinary approach.
Your support will equip me with access to the resources most essential to my research and creative work. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Spread the word! Tweet, Facebook and e-mail your friends and family about my work! Or you can e-mail at ethosmoda (at) gmail (dot) com and I'll send you a widget for my fundraising page to place on your website or blog. Don't underestimate the power you have to make a difference! Every little thing counts!

Thanks for watching and reading and please follow my ethical fashion Italian adventure beginning 15 June 2011!
xoxo,

The Ethical Fashion Missionary <<<----on Facebook ▲ 
▲ The blog---->>> The Ethical Fashion Missionary

ETHOS▲DISEñO ---->>> my website

story:
Why is the Lufbery Trench Watch unique?

 

My name is Stuart and I am a History teacher, watch enthusiast and the founder of Lufbery Watches. I am a huge fan of vintage military watches and I have spent years building up a modest collection. However, the watch that I could never find to complete it was the first ever military watch and the grandfather of every military watch in existence: the trench watch. The original WW1-era trench watches are too unreliable to use today (they are over one hundred years old) or too small (some are only 34mm in diameter) to wear out and about.

There are homage trench watches on the market, but they are either way out of my History teacher salary's budget or are just extremely poor quality and cheap looking. I created the Lufbery Trench Watch after years of searching for a wearable homage version and I can say with confidence that the Lufbery Trench Watch is unique. There are no watches on the market that pay homage to the original trench watch design as closely as the Lufbery Trench Watch that are also well made and reasonably priced. 

 

Created by a History teacher

 

As a History teacher I love trench watches. They were the first watches built for battle; every military watch in existence can trace its origin to the trench watch, from the classic field watches of the Vietnam War-era to the 'Dirty Dozen' from WW2. Trench watches were the first masculine watch; they were designed to be tough, solid and practical (they had to survive the battlefields of Flanders after all) and were in complete contrast to the dainty pocket watches which came before them. As well as being tough, trench watches were also design icons, with stunning art nouveau dials, hands and numerals.

The Lufbery Trench Watch pays homage to the original trench watches as much as possible, in both its solid toughness and its iconic style. In order to recognise the influence that the original trench watches have had on the Lufbery Trench Watches design, on the back of every Lufbery case is an engraving of a WW1-era British Mark VII tank. These saw action in 1918, just as the trench watch was becoming ubiquitous on the front-line. 

 

The Lufbery Trench Watch versus the WW1-era trench watches

 

The case

 

The original trench watches were small: normally they were 36mm in diameter, however there were some as small as 34mm diameter. The Lufbery Trench Watch is designed for the twenty-first century, so it is 40mm in diameter and 48mm lug to lug. The original trench watches were solid and so is the Lufbery Trench Watch. The case is crafted from premium 316L stainless steel and is tough. Each Lufbery Trench Watch comes with a two-year guarantee.

 

The crystal

 

The crystal on the Lufbery Trench Watch is scratch resistant sapphire glass. One issue with original trench watches is that they had mineral glass which sometimes scratched or shattered in battle conditions.

 

The dial
 

The dials, the numerals and the hands of the Lufbery Trench Watch are accurate when you compare them to the original trench watches. It is very rare to find a watch with the colouring of the Lufbery Dragoon now, however in WW1 they were fairly common due to the fact the contrast meant they were easier to see at night.

 

Luminous hands and numerals
 

The original trench watches had radium coated hands and numerals. Radium is now illegal to use due to its radioactivity, so I opted for C3 super-luminova with the Lufbery Trench Watches. 

 

The movement
 

The Lufbery Trench Watches are equipped with two different types of movement. The quartz version is powered by a Seiko VD78 movement and prices start at £110. The automatic version is powered by Seiko NH15 movement (the movement has 21 jewels) and prices start at £160. Original trench watches were always mechanical as they pre-dated automatic movements (invented in 1922) and quartz movements (invented by Seiko in 1969).

 

The finishing touches
 

The original trench watches often had maker's marks engraved onto the case. The Lufbery Trench Watch has a 1918 Mark VII tank engraved on the back. This is to commemorate the link between the Lufbery Trench Watch and the original designs from WW1. On the crown of the Lufbery Trench Watch is the Lufbery logo, which is inspired by the British Army's 'broad arrow' which was engraved on all military equipment during the First World War.

 

Specifications

Case size: 40mm.

Case thickness: 11mm.

Lug Width: 18mm.

Lug to Lug: 48mm.

Caseback: Engraving of a Mark VII WW1 tank (the Lufbery's official name is the Lufbery Mark VII. The Lufbery Mark VI was the range of pocket watches that were on Kickstarter in February 2017).

Crown: Screw-down with an engraving of the Lufbery logo (inspired by the British military's broad arrow).

Movement: Seiko NH15 (automatic) or Seiko VD78 (quartz) depending on the model.

Dial: Applied 3D Indexes filled with C3 super-luminova.

Crystal: Domed sapphire crystal.

Water resistant: 5ATM

Strap: Italian calf leather. 18mm in width.

Packaging: Lufbery box.

Warranty: 2 years.

 

The Lufbery Trench Watch Collection

 

The Lufbery Grenadier 

Named after the Grenadier regiments of the British Army. The design of the Lufbery Grenadier is very accurate to that of the original trench watches. The Quartz version has the small second dial, the Automatic version has the date window.

 

The Lufbery Dragoon

Named after the Dragoon regiments of the British Army. The black and white dial was extremely common during WW1-era trench watches due to the fact the contrasting colours made it easier to see at night. Today the design is extremely rare; I have never seen a watch with a similar dial despite years of searching. The Quartz version has the small second dial, the Automatic version has the date window.

The Lufbery Fusilier

Named after the Fusilier regiments of the British Army. The design of the Fusilier is also very accurate to that of the original trench watches. The Quartz version has the small second dial, the Automatic version has the date window.

 

The Lufbery Highlander

Named after the Highland regiments of the British Army. There were no WW1-era trench watches with the black on black design, it just wouldn't be practical in a battle. I went with it though because I think it looks pretty cool. The Quartz version has the small second dial, the Automatic version has the date window.

The Lufbery Scots Greys

Named after the Royal Scots Greys, a now defunct cavalry regiment which my Grandfather served in during the Third Anglo-Afghan War. There were some WW1-era trench watches with a bronze case (note that the Lufbery Scots Greys has a stainless-steel case with a bronze finish), however they were fairly rare and are very valuable today. The Quartz version has the small second dial, the Automatic version has the date window.

The Lufbery Engineer

Named after the Engineer regiments of the British Army. Like the Lufbery Scots Greys there were some original trench watches with this design, however they were pretty rare. The Quartz version has the small second dial, the Automatic version has the date window.

Reviews

 

 

Packaging

 

All Lufbery Trench Watches come in a specially crafted box with an information booklet. Like the actual Lufbery Trench Watches, the box is excellent quality and is made to last. 

 

About Lufbery Watches

 

The first Lufbery Watches Kickstarter campaign was in February 2017 for a collection of pocket watches inspired by the cockpit watches of the First World War. The company is named after the WW1 aerial manoeuvre known as the Lufbery Circle and our logo is inspired by the British Army’s ‘broad arrow’ which was stamped on the back of all military equipment during WW1. Check out our Kickstarter video from 2017 below.

 

In April, the Lufbery Trench Watch was originally launched on Kickstarter, but sadly didn’t do as well as I hoped (please check out the Kickstarter video below). I would like to thank the Lufbery Trench Watch backers and fans who have been kind enough to offer me feedback on the design. This campaign wouldn't have relaunched without your help. 

 

 About me

 

My name is Stuart and I am a History teacher and watch enthusiast from Surrey, UK. I am married with two children and I have had so much fun creating the Lufbery Trench Watch. I hope you love the design and find the history as interesting as I do.

 

Risks and challenges

 

Forecasting Risk Taking the Lufbery from prototype to production will almost certainly have unforeseen issues, but we've done our best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan. Should we miss projections, we'll let you know when and why, and make it right as soon as possible. Supply Chain Risk We are very confident in our supply chain which consists of very professional and talented suppliers and manufacturers. We do not expect any delays to our timeline, but if the unexpected happens, rest assured we will keep you well informed until you receive your timepiece.

story:
We're Hamtun Watches and since 2015 we’ve been designing modern, high-quality watches that people can actually afford. This is our 4th pre-order campaign and the Nanok is the culmination of all of that experience in one stunning watch.

By combining classic, time-tested Swiss technology with subtle modern design touches, we've built a watch that is immediately recognisable yet also completely new.

Some people like to wear a different watch every day, and we get that. There are so many beautiful ones out there! But we're romantics for a time when people owned a single watch for their whole life, and the Nanok is our vision of that watch. A combination of classic Swiss technology and modern styling, it's designed for a lifetime on your wrist.

At Hamtun we make watches that we want to own. Our designs are lead by instinct and passion, not market research and spreadsheets. You’ll see lots of different styles in our catalogue because we build what excites us.

Since day one the goal has been to build a diverse range of watches so that we'd never wake up and be tempted to wear a watch that we didn't make. With the Nanok we've taken a giant leap towards achieving that.

Part of building a watch for all situations is making sure that it's not too thick. If a watch can't fit under a shirt cuff, it's not an everyday watch for lots of people! We focussed on this, and the Nanok comes in at just 10.6mm thick. Despite the additional functionality of the day & date movement, it's the thinnest watch we've ever made.

Like most high-end watches, the Nanok has a 316L stainless steel case and a sapphire crystal (which is flat with internal anti-reflective coatings) making it incredibly tough, while the screw-down crown ensures it's water resistant to 100 metres/10ATM. You can swim with your watch without worrying.

Despite all of that toughness, Nanok weighs in at just 66g on the leather strap and 138g on the bracelet. You'll hardly notice it's there! And if it gets a bit dark, the genuine Swiss Super-LumiNova BGW9 lume will keep your watch visible long into the night.

The Nanok features a Swiss made Sellita SW 240-1. It's a well known and time-tested movement that will be easy to maintain and service for years to come.

The SW 240-1 is an automatic movement with a high 28,800 bpm beat rate, resulting in the super smooth second hand sweep that defines high-end watches. As it's automatic you'll never need a battery, just wearing it will keep it running.

It features 26 jewels. Jewels are used in movements to avoid having metal parts rubbing together. It prevents wear and extends the life between services.

Importantly, it is made by Sellita. Sellita is a long-established Swiss company whose movements appear in the watches of some of the biggest and most famous watch brands in the world. This is a serious movement for a serious watch.

If you own a watch that you love you probably wear it a lot, so you'll know that over time it'll start to look a bit worn. No matter how careful you are with it, it's inevitable that marks and hairline scratches will start to appear.

What if we could do something about that? Well now we can!

Thanks to recent advances in the technology we can now add a scratch resistant coating to the outside of 316L stainless steel watches and so reduce the risk of marking or damaging the metal over time. Until recently this was only an option on watches at a vastly higher price.

If you decide to have your watch treated it will be far more resistant to scratches and marks, and so should stay new looking for far longer.

That's not to say we can make the watch completely scratch proof (it's not magic), but you'll find that your Nanok will be far less susceptible to the signs of wear that are associated with standard, untreated watches.

How does it work?

We apply a tiny coating to the outside of the watch (and bracelet if you order one). At about 3.0 microns thick, it's basically invisible. You'll notice a very slight change in the colour of the metal when compared directly with an uncoated watch, but that's it. Once the coating is added, the hardness rating of the outside of the watch goes up from about 225HV (the hardness rating of standard 316L stainless steel) to 900-1100HV.

What does that actually mean? Well Corning® Gorilla® Glass 6 (the latest version of the stuff most smartphones use) has a rating of around 680HV, while sapphire crystal has a rating of somewhere over 2000HV. So the coating on your watch case will be somewhere between the two, and many times harder than standard 316L stainless steel.

What does the hardening cost?

The hardening process costs an extra £40 on top of the price of your watch. When you order your Nanok just add an extra £40 to your pledge, we'll be in touch at the end of the campaign to confirm your choice.

Why an option rather than a default?

The coating process costs more and it takes a bit more time. We don't want to raise the price and increase the lead time for people that aren't interested in the additional long-term protection. It'll take around a month longer to deliver your Nanok if you go for this option, but the result will be a watch tougher than any made from standard 316L steel.

We're offering three strap options for the Nanok so that you can make it work for you from day one. We'll also be making further options available via our store in the future so that Nanok continues to adapt to your style. Or, of course, you can pick up a strap from your retailer of choice, there is nothing proprietary about our straps. 

1) Pick one from our choice of two genuine leather straps, included in the base price. Available in grey or black and handmade from vegetable tanned leather, these straps are the best we've found at any price point. Comfortable, soft and light, the leather strap can dress up or down easily depending on your day.

2) A 316L stainless steel H-link bracelet with ratcheting clasp, available for an extra £30. H-link bracelets hold their shape really well, resulting in a solid, high-quality feel. Ratcheting clasps help ensure that whatever the size of your wrist, you can adjust the bracelet perfectly. The bracelet features all solid links, of course, and tapers from 20mm at the lugs to 18mm at the clasp.

If you'd like both a leather strap and the bracelet that's fine, just add £35 to your pledge.
